Cell.Data: [Tips 1/14] Soldier of Fortune mode: Mandates\n\nIn this game mode you will have to work with the Host of the Purple Phoenix to handle Mandates and Expeditions as a bounty hunter. Talk to “Dashing” Eugene on the right of the screen, he will get you started on your first mandate and reward you upon quest completion.

[Tips 2/14] Core Combat Mechanics Weapon combos: There is a different attack combo per weapon type Melee-dash: Melee characters can automatically dash on a foe every 5s. Toggled via the HUD (F) Use skills: Up to 5 abilities can be and added to the skill bar (1, 2, 3, 4, and RIGHT CLICK)

[Tips 3/14] Health Management Health: If your health pool reaches 0 you are out of combat Potions: Use one of your two potions to help you in combat (Q W). Replenish them by killing foes Potion types: There are Health, Rage and Willpower potions

[Tips 4/14] Leveling up in Wolcen Basic progression: Each level grants you 1 of each attribute, max health and health regeneration Customize attributes: You earn 10 more points to distribute in the Character Sheet (C) Passive skills: And 1 passive point to spend in the Passive Skill Tree (P)

[Tips 5/14] Dodge Rolling Dodge roll: Allows you to evade dangerous attacks in the cursor direction (SPACE BAR) Stamina points: A roll consumes a stamina point. A character starts with 4 points Stamina regeneration: Stamina points regenerate quickly over time

[Tips 6/14] Resource Opposition System Resources: Spells consume Willpower while Attacks skills use Rage Opposition: When Willpower is used it is transferred over time to the Rage amount and vice-versa Transfer Time: Resources are unusable for a short time while they transfer

[Tips 7/14] New Combat Skills Loot new skills: Kill foes and loot items containing skills. They are called Enneracts Learning: In the inventory (I) use the Enneract to learn its skill (RIGHT CLICK on it) Buying skill levels: Sell them to Demetra and gain Primordial Affinity to level up your skills

[Tips 8/14] Skills upgrades Skill experience: Skills in your action bar will gain experience when you do New effects: Every five skill levels, you unlock a new talent option for it Skill customization: Adapt your skills to fit your playstyle and try new combos.

[Tips 9/14] Status Ailments Damage types: All damage types except Physical have a chance to inflict an additional effect Status ailment chance: Increase the chances with the Wisdom attribute, passives and gear Status ailment resistance: Likewise, enemies can inflict these same effects on you

[Tips 10/14] Unlocked “Expedition mode” with Alexander Ivakin Full random: In this mode, environments and foes are totally shuffled. Beware of new synergies Six levels challenge: Increased difficulty from level to level, each finishing with a boss fight Limited town portal: Defeat a level boss to have the option to stop the expedition for a reward

[Tips 11/14] Character Sheet Stats bundles: Each Attribute groups bonuses useful for most playstyles Damage bonuses: Your three main attributes give bonus damage according to their ranking Detailed Character Sheet: Click on “Show details” to know more about in-depth statistics

[Tips 12/14] Passive Skill Tree Class freedom: Create your own path starting from the center Points allocation: If you have points to spend, permanently select one node to gain its effect(s) Major nodes: These offer stronger effects that can change the game rules permanently. Try to fetch as many as possible [Tips 13/14] Rotating Circles Multiple starts: You are free to start back from the tree center and explore different paths simultaneously Rotate rings to create new paths: Click on a ring on the left panel and rotate it with arrows to reveal new possibilities Connected nodes: Eligible nodes must always be connected to the center or to an already chosen node. Non-eligible nodes that result from a ring rotation will be temporarily turned off until they are connected again

[Tips 14/14] Active Skill Tree Skill improvement: Every 5 skill levels you unlock a new effect that you can activate Additional effect: When your skill reaches level 15 you can activate up to two skill effects Freedom to try: Skill points can be reallocated on the fly at no cost
<font color="#c5b14d">Left-Click</font> to walk around. Head North and <font color="#c5b14d">left-click</font> on the ladder to climb up the cliff.

Watch out, there are dangerous enemies up ahead.
To defeat them, <font color="#c5b14d">Left-Click</font>.
Press <font color="#c5b14d">Space</font> to dodge roll.\n\nUse dodge rolls to avoid taking damage and re-position.
Dodge rolls require <font color="#9cba7b">stamina points</font>, which are recovered over time.
<font color="#c5b14d">Right-Click</font> to pick up items.\n\nCheck out your inventory by pressing<font color="#c5b14d">I</font>.

<font color="#c5b14d">RIGHT-CLICK</font> to pick up items. Check out your inventory by pressing<font color="#c5b14d">I</font>.

Equip new weapons and armor by dragging it to its respective slot.

Compare new items with equipped items by hovering over the new item.
Low on health? Press <font color="#c5b14d">Q</font> to use your <font color="#b22023">Health</font> Potion.
Potions refill as you defeat enemies.
Skills require either <font color="#948ec6">Willpower</font> or <font color="#cb5316">Rage</font> to be cast.
The types of skills you can cast are based on the weapon you are wielding
Consult your Active Skills by pressing <font color="#c5b14d">S</font>.
Press <font color="#c5b14d">C</font> to open your character sheet.
Assign points to the 4 different attributes. Each attribute affects different aspects of your character.
Press <font color="#c5b14d">P</font> to open your Passive Skill Tree and assign skill points.
Press <font color="#c5b14d">M</font> to access the world map. Select a waypoint to teleport to that location.
Press <font color="#c5b14d">T</font> to use the town portal to return to Stormfall.
<font color="#c5b14d">Left-Click</font> on items in the store to buy them.\n\n<font color="#c5b14d">Right-Click</font> on items in your inventory to sell them.
New items are available for purchase every 15 minutes.
You can trade an Enneract with Demetra for Primordial Affinity, which is used to level up skills at her shop.
Increasing the level of a skill unlocks spell modifiers. Press <font color="#c5b14d">S</font> to open the Active Skills menu.
Skills can also level up while being used in combat.
You have received an Enneract, an ancient magical device.\n\n<font color="#c5b14d">Right-Click</font> the Enneract in your inventory to learn a new skill.
<font color="#c5b14d">Right-Click</font> the Enneract in your inventory to learn a new skill.

<Font Size="13">When wielding a melee weapon, you will automatically dash to an enemy when attacking them. This dash has a cooldown.\n\nPress <font color="#c5b14d">Space</font> to dodge roll. Each dodge roll requires a <font color="#9cba7b">stamina point</font>, which are recovered over time.</font>
• LEFT-CLICK to walk around. Head North and LEFT-CLICK on the ladder to climb up the cliff.

• LEFT-CLICK enemies to Attack them. When wielding a Melee Weapon, you will automatically Dash Attack enemies. This dash has a cooldown. • Press SPACE to Dodge Roll. Dodge Rolls have a small window of invulnerability. Dodge Rolls require Stamina points, which are recovered over time. • Press RIGHT-CLICK to unleash a powerful electric attack.
• You are low on Health. If you run out of Health, you will go down.\n\n• Press Q to use your Health Potion to heal up. Potions refill as you defeat enemies
• To use a Skill, RIGHT-CLICK. Skills require either Willpower or Rage to be cast.\n\n• The types of Skills you can cast are based on your equipped Weapon. Consult your Active Skills by pressing S.

• You have gained a level. • Press C to open your Character Sheet. Assign points to the 4 different Attributes. Each Attribute affects different aspects of your character. • Press P to open your Passive Skill Tree and assign Skill Points.
• Press M to access the World Map. Select a Waypoint to teleport to that location.
• Press T to use the Town Portal to return to the Stormfall hub. You can return there whenever you need to and a Portal will bring you back.
• LEFT-CLICK on items in the store to buy them. RIGHT-CLICK on items in your Inventory to sell them.\n\nItems change every 15 minutes.

• You are about to receive an Enneract, an ancient magical device. RIGHT-CLICK the Enneract in your Inventory to learn a new Skill. • You can trade Enneracts with Demetra for Primordial Affinity, which is used to level up Skills at her shop. • Increasing the level of a Skill unlocks Skill Modifiers. Press S to open the Active Skills Menu. • Skills can level up while being used in combat.

• LEFT-CLICK to pick up items. Check out your Inventory by pressing I. • Equip new weapons and armor by dragging them to their respective slot. • Compare new items with equipped items by hovering over the new item.

• All <font color="#72c6db">Attibutes</font> increase by one when you level up. You are given 10 <font color="#72c6db">Attribute Points</font> to assign freely with every level.

• The 3 <font color="#72c6db">Attributes</font> with the most points increase your overall damage output.

• You can reset your <font color="#72c6db">Attribute Points</font> and <font color="#72c6db">Passive Skill Points</font> using <font color="#efd373">Gold</font> and <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> respectively.

• You are given 2 <font color="#72c6db">Passive Skill Points</font> each time you level up, up to a total of 38. Assign your <font color="#72c6db">Points</font> and then <font color="#72c6db">Confirm</font> them.\n\n• You can turn the <font color="#72c6db">Gate of Fates</font> using the ring interface, allowing you to mix and match nodes freely.
